comments:
I200409070800

Open a source type in the java editor. Doubleclick the vertical ruler at a line
which is outside of a type declaration (e.g. at the package declaration or an
import statement).

=> Log:
Error Sep 14, 2004 14:52:09.922 An internal error occurred during: "Breakpoint
location validation".
java.lang.NullPointerException
	at
org.eclipse.jdt.internal.debug.ui.actions.BreakpointLocationVerifierJob.run(BreakpointLocationVerifierJob.java:125)
	at org.eclipse.core.internal.jobs.Worker.run(Worker.java:66)

Fixed.
This was a side effect of the fix for bug 73018. The type is not always available.
I reworked a bit this code. The code added for bug 53102 was not working for
external source file, the information needed to be able to resolve the bindings
is not always available.

ValidBreakpointLocationLocator - added a parameter to the constructor to know if
the AST was create with bindings or not. Modified the implementation to use this
information.
BreakpointLocationVerifierJob - Added code to generate a good compilation unit
name when adding a breakpoint outside of a type. Added code to check if we are
able to resolve the bindings.
ReturnToLineAdaptor - updated to call the new constructor of
ValidBreakpointLocationLocator
